title: Get Started

title: Creating a Pediatrics ADVS ADaM
text: article describes creating vital signs ADaM pediatric clinical trials. package creates SD scores (z-scores) percentiles among children adolescents various body measures, Height, Weight, Body Mass Index (BMI), Weight--Length, Head Circumference. Among adults, standard cut-points can used (e.g., BMI >= 30 obesity), large changes occur growth development, measures typically expressed relative children sex age. example, CDC classifies obesity BMI--age >= 95th percentile (z-score 1.645), cut point weight--length >= 3 SDs among children 2 years age. advise first consult admiral Creating BDS Finding ADaM vignette. programming workflow around creating general set-ADVS using admiral functions . focus pediatric-specific steps avoid repeating information maintaining content two places. Note: examples assume CDISC SDTM /ADaM format input unless otherwise specified.

title: Creating a Pediatrics ADVS ADaM

text: required packages loaded, first step preparing metadata. , made default decisions regarding metadata use package. free replace source prefer (long keep structure dataframe consistent - expected downstream functions). example, might want use different age range selection metadata (including reference data ages 5-19 years) International Obesity Task Force reference data. selection growth reference files included used metadata package follows: 2000 CDC Growth Charts BMI : 2022 CDC Extended BMI--age Growth Charts 2006 Growth Standards - Expanded Tables: Birth 5 years
code: library(admiral) library(pharmaversesdtm, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(admiralpeds) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(lubridate) library(rlang) library(stringr)

previous_headings: Programming Workflow > Metadata
what: Reference Files for Parameters by Age
title: Creating a Pediatrics ADVS ADaM
text: growth rates patterns differ age sex, reference values differ two characteristics. various measures, use reference data children <2 years age (<730.5 days) CDC growth charts children >=2 years age (>=730.5 days). accord CDC recommendation. reference data charts include LMS parameters, L Box-Cox transformation normality, M median, S coefficient variation. , first step combining metadata measure ensuring sex age shown consistently. separate CDC metadata weight-based derivations due (1) adjustment (restricted application LMS method) (2) CDC extended method high BMIs. Additionally, CDC growth charts offer monthly age intervals, advice retired CDC expert area, added interpolation code template record day age. converting CDC months days (30.4375 days month), rounded nearest whole number days. Relying monthly charts result less accurate calculations, particularly weight height values among children 2 years age. prefer rely solely monthly chart , remove rounding call derive_interp_records() function. pre-processing metadata using following code BMI example: first records metadata BMI now look: Similarly, CDC metadata: BMI CDC metadata, dispersion parameter (Sigma) used calculate BMI percentiles z-scores sex- age-specific 95th percentile (P95). example shows parameter BMI, follows parameters like weight height. can combine CDC metadata height adjustment unnecessary. Note head circumference parameter metadata comes reference data, CDC provides equivalent children > 2 years age.
code: who_bmi_for_age_boys <- admiralpeds::who_bmi_for_age_boys who_bmi_for_age_girls <- admiralpeds::who_bmi_for_age_girls cdc_bmiage <- admiralpeds::cdc_bmiage  who_bmi_for_age <- who_bmi_for_age_boys %>%   mutate(SEX = "M") %>%   bind_rows(who_bmi_for_age_girls %>%     mutate(SEX = "F")) %>%   # Keep patients < 2 yrs old   filter(Day < 730.5) %>%   rename(AGE = Day) %>%   # AGEU is added in metadata, required for derive_params_growth_age()   mutate(AGEU = "DAYS") %>%   arrange(AGE, SEX)  cdc_bmi_for_age <- cdc_bmiage %>%   mutate(     SEX = case_when(       SEX == 1 ~ "M",       SEX == 2 ~ "F",       TRUE ~ NA_character_     ),     # Ensure first that Age unit is "DAYS"     AGE = round(AGE * 30.4375),     AGEU = "DAYS"   ) %>%   # Interpolate the AGE by SEX so that we get CDC metadata by day instead of   # month in the same way as WHO metadata   derive_interp_records(     by_vars = exprs(SEX),     parameter = "BMI"   ) %>%   # Keep patients >= 2 yrs till 20 yrs - Remove duplicates for 730 Days old which   # must come from WHO metadata only   filter(AGE >= 730.5 & AGE <= 7305) %>%   arrange(AGE, SEX)

what: Reference Files for Weight by Length/Height
title: Creating a Pediatrics ADVS ADaM
text: provides additional reference data weight--length (recumbent length), instead age. , combined metadata sex create single reference file. also weight--height files available, upon advice retired CDC expert area, chose include weight--length files, children can stand, BMI age appropriate measure use. However, template, give metadata values variable generic name, HEIGHT_LENGTH, user equally choose pass weight--height files preferred. using following code: metadata now looks body length 65cm:
code: who_wt_for_lgth_boys <- admiralpeds::who_wt_for_lgth_boys who_wt_for_lgth_girls <- admiralpeds::who_wt_for_lgth_girls  who_wt_for_lgth <- who_wt_for_lgth_boys %>%   mutate(SEX = "M") %>%   bind_rows(who_wt_for_lgth_girls %>%     mutate(SEX = "F")) %>%   mutate(HEIGHT_LENGTHU = "cm") %>%   rename(HEIGHT_LENGTH = Length)

code: # Calculate Current Analysis Age AAGECUR and unit AAGECURU advs <- advs %>%   derive_vars_duration(     new_var = AAGECUR,     new_var_unit = AAGECURU,     start_date = BRTHDT,     end_date = ADT   )

what: Derived Variables for Weight by Length/Height
title: Creating a Pediatrics ADVS ADaM
text: Similar , variable current analysis length/height achieved using following code:
code: # Derive Current HEIGHT/LENGTH at each time point Temporary variable advs <- advs %>%   derive_vars_merged(     dataset_add = advs,     by_vars = c(get_admiral_option("subject_keys"), exprs(AVISIT)),     filter_add = PARAMCD == "HEIGHT" & toupper(VSSTRESU) == "CM",     new_vars = exprs(HGTTMP = AVAL, HGTTMPU = VSSTRESU)   )

what: Derive Additional Parameters for Anthropometric indicators
title: Creating a Pediatrics ADVS ADaM
text: Now, get important section, shows create new records derived pediatrics parameter. specific examples included , ’ll find parameters example template script referenced bottom vignette.

previous_headings: Programming Workflow > Derive Additional Parameters for Anthropometric indicators
title: Creating a Pediatrics ADVS ADaM
text: Parameters BMI--age z-scores percentiles achieved using derive_params_growth_age() function follows: z-score percentile needed, leave one set_values_to_ arguments. , essential remember importance metadata supplied function via meta_criteria argument. default case package uses reference data children < 2 years age CDC reference data children >= 2 years age. user, can use (e.g., International Obesity Task Force) reference data files created LMS method. BMI , ’ll notice code set bmi_cdc_correction = TRUE. used CDC extended percentiles (> 95th percentile) monitor high BMI values . left argument default FALSE value, 2000 CDC Growth Chart BMI used CDC metadata. 2022, CDC released extended percentiles (z-scores) BMIs > 95th percentile original CDC method accurately characterize high BMIs. weight-based parameters (including BMI), ’ll also see code set who_correction = TRUE. comes Child Growth Standards Guidelines (pages 301-304). correction made used LMS method weight-based measures calculated z-scores -3 +3; correction allows calculation extreme z-scores. using metadata (metadata length head circumference), leave who_correction = FALSE, usual LMS method applied. recommends using correction parameters involve weight (including BMI). newly derived parameters look: height parameters age, noted growth chart use children <2 years age refers body length, whereas CDC growth chart children >=2 years age refers height. explained thoroughly next section.
code: ## Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts ## For BMI by Age advs <- advs %>%   slice_derivation(     derivation = derive_params_growth_age,     args = params(       sex = SEX,       age = AAGECUR,       age_unit = AAGECURU,       parameter = VSTESTCD == "BMI",       analysis_var = AVAL,       set_values_to_sds = exprs(         PARAMCD = "BMISDS",         PARAM = "BMI-for-age z-score"       ),       set_values_to_pctl = exprs(         PARAMCD = "BMIPCTL",         PARAM = "BMI-for-age percentile"       )     ),     derivation_slice(       filter = AAGECUR < 730.5,       args = params(         who_correction = TRUE,         meta_criteria = who_bmi_for_age       )     ),     derivation_slice(       filter = AAGECUR >= 730.5,       args = params(         bmi_cdc_correction = TRUE,         meta_criteria = cdc_bmi_for_age       )     )   )

previous_headings: Programming Workflow > Derive Additional Parameters for Anthropometric indicators
title: Creating a Pediatrics ADVS ADaM
text: following code Weight Length/Height z-score percentile children < 2 years age, assumes “HEIGHT” parameter always collected recumbent length. ’ll notice derive_params_growth_height() function used similar used , now passing height length instead age. consulted pediatrician extensive experience working length height data, advised analysts rarely know whether standing height recumbent length measured. depends mainly age child can stand (average, two years) preference measurer. strict CRF (case report form) guidelines standing height (rather body length) measured, add 0.7 cm values approximate child’s body length.
code: advs <- advs %>%   restrict_derivation(     derivation = derive_params_growth_height,     args = params(       sex = SEX,       height = HGTTMP,       height_unit = HGTTMPU,       meta_criteria = who_wt_for_lgth,       parameter = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT",       analysis_var = AVAL,       who_correction = TRUE,       set_values_to_sds = exprs(         PARAMCD = "WGTHSDS",         PARAM = "Weight-for-length/height Z-Score"       ),       set_values_to_pctl = exprs(         PARAMCD = "WGTHPCTL",         PARAM = "Weight-for-length/height Percentile"       )     ),     filter = AAGECUR < 730.5   )

title: Derive interpolated rows for the CDC charts (>=2 yrs old) — derive_interp_records
Derive interpolated rows for the CDC charts (>=2 yrs old) — derive_interp_records
text: dataset Input metadataset variables AGE, AGEU, SEX, L, M, S expected dataset BMI additional variables P95 Sigma expected dataset Note AGE must days AGEU equal "DAYS" by_vars Grouping variables variable dataset identifies group observations interpolate separately. parameter CDC/metadata parameter Permitted Values: "WEIGHT", "HEIGHT" "BMI" - Must NULL e.g. parameter = "WEIGHT", parameter = "HEIGHT",   parameter = "BMI".

title: Derive interpolated rows for the CDC charts (>=2 yrs old) — derive_interp_records
text: input dataset plus additional interpolated records: record day minimum age maximum age. variables addition expected ones input dataset, LOCF (Last Observation Carried Forward) applied populate new records.

title: Derive interpolated rows for the CDC charts (>=2 yrs old) — derive_interp_records
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(rlang, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  cdc_htage <- admiralpeds::cdc_htage %>%   mutate(     SEX = case_when(       SEX == 1 ~ "M",       SEX == 2 ~ "F",       TRUE ~ NA_character_     ),     # Ensure first that Age unit is "DAYS"     AGE = round(AGE * 30.4375),     AGEU = "DAYS"   )  # Interpolate the AGE by SEX derive_interp_records(   dataset = cdc_htage,   by_vars = exprs(SEX),   parameter = "HEIGHT" ) #> # A tibble: 13,152 × 6 #>    SEX     AGE     L     M      S AGEU  #>    <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <chr> #>  1 F       730  1.07  85.0 0.0408 DAYS  #>  2 F       731  1.07  85.0 0.0408 DAYS  #>  3 F       732  1.07  85.0 0.0408 DAYS  #>  4 F       733  1.07  85.1 0.0408 DAYS  #>  5 F       734  1.07  85.1 0.0408 DAYS  #>  6 F       735  1.07  85.1 0.0408 DAYS  #>  7 F       736  1.06  85.1 0.0408 DAYS  #>  8 F       737  1.06  85.2 0.0408 DAYS  #>  9 F       738  1.06  85.2 0.0408 DAYS  #> 10 F       739  1.06  85.2 0.0408 DAYS  #> # ℹ 13,142 more rows

what: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
text: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles--Age) based Standard Growth Charts Height/Weight/BMI/Head Circumference Age

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
code: derive_params_growth_age(   dataset,   sex,   age,   age_unit,   meta_criteria,   parameter,   analysis_var,   bmi_cdc_correction = FALSE,   who_correction = FALSE,   set_values_to_sds = NULL,   set_values_to_pctl = NULL )

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified sex, age, age_unit, parameter, analysis_var expected dataset. sex Sex character vector expected. Expected Values: M, F age Current Age numeric vector expected. Note actual age current visit. age_unit Age Unit character vector expected. Expected values: days, weeks, months meta_criteria Metadata dataset metadata dataset following expected variables: AGE, AGEU, SEX, L, M, S dataset can derived CDC/user-defined datasets. CDC/growth chart metadata datasets available package require small modifications. age value dataset falls two AGE values meta_criteria, L/M/S values chosen/mapped AGE smaller absolute difference value age. e.g. dataset current age 27.49 months, metadata contains records 27 28 months, L/M/S corresponding 27 months record used. AGE - Age AGEU - Age Unit SEX - Sex L - Power Box-Cox transformation normality M - Median S - Coefficient variation parameter Anthropometric measurement parameter calculate z-score percentile condition expected input dataset VSTESTCD/PARAMCD want growth derivations: e.g. parameter = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT". CDC/metadata available Height, Weight, BMI, Head Circumference available admiralpeds package. analysis_var Variable containing anthropometric measurement numeric vector expected, e.g. AVAL, VSSTRESN bmi_cdc_correction Extended CDC BMI--age correction logical scalar, e.g. TRUE/FALSE expected. CDC developed extended percentiles (>95%) monitor high BMI values, set TRUE CDC's correction applied. who_correction adjustment weight-based indicators logical scalar, e.g. TRUE/FALSE expected. constructed restricted application LMS method weight-based indicators. details exact rules applied can found document page 302 Child Growth Standards Guidelines. set TRUE correction applied. set_values_to_sds Variables set Z-Scores specified variables set specified values new observations. example, set_values_to_sds(exprs(PARAMCD = "BMIASDS", PARAM = "BMI--age z-score")) defines parameter code parameter. formula calculate Z-score follows: $$\frac{((\frac{obs}{M})^L - 1)}{L * S}$$ "obs" observed value respective anthropometric measure calculated. Permitted Values: List variable-value pairs left default value, NULL, parameter derived output dataset set_values_to_pctl Variables set Percentile specified variables set specified values new observations. example, set_values_to_pctl(exprs(PARAMCD = "BMIAPCTL", PARAM = "BMI--age percentile")) defines parameter code parameter. Permitted Values: List variable-value pair left default value, NULL, parameter derived output dataset

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
text: input dataset additional records new parameter added.

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(lubridate, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(rlang, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(admiral, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(pharmaversesdtm, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  advs <- pharmaversesdtm::dm_peds %>%   select(USUBJID, BRTHDTC, SEX) %>%   right_join(., pharmaversesdtm::vs_peds, by = "USUBJID") %>%   mutate(     VSDT = ymd(VSDTC),     BRTHDT = ymd(BRTHDTC)   ) %>%   derive_vars_duration(     new_var = AGECUR_D,     new_var_unit = CURU_D,     start_date = BRTHDT,     end_date = VSDT,     out_unit = "days",     trunc_out = FALSE   ) %>%   derive_vars_duration(     new_var = AGECUR_M,     new_var_unit = CURU_M,     start_date = BRTHDT,     end_date = VSDT,     out_unit = "months",     trunc_out = FALSE   ) %>%   mutate(     AGECUR = ifelse(AGECUR_D >= 365.25 * 2, AGECUR_M, AGECUR_D),     AGECURU = ifelse(AGECUR_D >= 365.25 * 2, CURU_M, CURU_D)   )  # metadata is in months cdc_meta_criteria <- admiralpeds::cdc_htage %>%   mutate(     age_unit = "months",     SEX = ifelse(SEX == 1, "M", "F")   )  # metadata is in days who_meta_criteria <- bind_rows(   (admiralpeds::who_lgth_ht_for_age_boys %>%     mutate(       SEX = "M",       age_unit = "days"     )   ),   (admiralpeds::who_lgth_ht_for_age_girls %>%     mutate(       SEX = "F",       age_unit = "days"     )   ) ) %>%   rename(AGE = Day)  criteria <- bind_rows(   cdc_meta_criteria,   who_meta_criteria ) %>%   rename(AGEU = age_unit)  derive_params_growth_age(   advs,   sex = SEX,   age = AGECUR,   age_unit = AGECURU,   meta_criteria = criteria,   parameter = VSTESTCD == "HEIGHT",   analysis_var = VSSTRESN,   set_values_to_sds = exprs(     PARAMCD = "HGTSDS",     PARAM = "Height-for-age z-score"   ),   set_values_to_pctl = exprs(     PARAMCD = "HGTPCTL",     PARAM = "Height-for-age percentile"   ) ) #> # A tibble: 232 × 39 #>    USUBJID     BRTHDTC  SEX   STUDYID DOMAIN VSSEQ VSTESTCD VSTEST VSPOS VSORRES #>    <chr>       <chr>    <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <int> <chr>    <chr>  <chr> <chr>   #>  1 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         1 BMI      BMI    NA    16.577… #>  2 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         5 BMI      BMI    NA    16.615… #>  3 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         9 BMI      BMI    NA    16.697… #>  4 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        13 BMI      BMI    NA    16.816… #>  5 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        17 BMI      BMI    NA    16.824… #>  6 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        21 BMI      BMI    NA    16.915… #>  7 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        25 BMI      BMI    NA    17.051… #>  8 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        29 BMI      BMI    NA    17.162… #>  9 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        33 BMI      BMI    NA    17.248… #> 10 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        37 BMI      BMI    NA    17.433… #> # ℹ 222 more rows #> # ℹ 29 more variables: VSORRESU <chr>, VSSTRESC <chr>, VSSTRESN <dbl>, #> #   VSSTRESU <chr>, VSSTAT <chr>, VSLOC <chr>, VSBLFL <chr>, VISITNUM <dbl>, #> #   VISIT <chr>, VISITDY <int>, VSDTC <chr>, VSDY <int>, VSTPT <chr>, #> #   VSTPTNUM <dbl>, VSELTM <chr>, VSTPTREF <chr>, VSEVAL <chr>, EPOCH <chr>, #> #   VSDT <date>, BRTHDT <date>, AGECUR_D <dbl>, CURU_D <chr>, AGECUR_M <dbl>, #> #   CURU_M <chr>, AGECUR <dbl>, AGECURU <chr>, AVAL <dbl>, PARAMCD <chr>, …

what: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
text: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles--Height/Length) based Standard Growth Charts Weight Height/Length

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
code: derive_params_growth_height(   dataset,   sex,   height,   height_unit,   meta_criteria,   parameter,   analysis_var,   who_correction = FALSE,   set_values_to_sds = NULL,   set_values_to_pctl = NULL )

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified sex, height, height_unit, parameter, analysis_var expected dataset. sex Sex character vector expected. Expected Values: M, F height Current Height/length numeric vector expected. Note actual height/length current visit. height_unit Height/Length Unit character vector expected. Expected values: cm meta_criteria Metadata dataset metadata dataset following expected variables: HEIGHT_LENGTH, HEIGHT_LENGTHU, SEX, L, M, S dataset can derived user-defined datasets. growth chart metadata datasets available package require small modifications. Datasets who_wt_for_lgth_boys/who_wt_for_lgth_girls applicable subject age < 730.5 days. height value dataset falls two HEIGHT_LENGTH values meta_criteria, L/M/S values chosen/mapped HEIGHT_LENGTH smaller absolute difference value height. e.g. dataset current age 50.49 cm, metadata contains records 50 51 cm, L/M/S corresponding 50 cm record used. HEIGHT_LENGTH - Height/Length HEIGHT_LENGTHU - Height/Length Unit SEX - Sex L - Power Box-Cox transformation normality M - Median S - Coefficient variation parameter Anthropometric measurement parameter calculate z-score percentile condition expected input dataset VSTESTCD/PARAMCD want growth derivations: e.g. parameter = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT". metadata available Weight available admiralpeds package. Weight measures expected unit "kg". analysis_var Variable containing anthropometric measurement numeric vector expected, e.g. AVAL, VSSTRESN who_correction adjustment weight-based indicators logical scalar, e.g. TRUE/FALSE expected. constructed restricted application LMS method weight-based indicators. details exact rules applied can found document page 302 Child Growth Standards Guidelines. set TRUE correction applied. set_values_to_sds Variables set Z-Scores specified variables set specified values new observations. example, set_values_to_sds(exprs(PARAMCD = "WGTHSDS", PARAM = "Weight--height z-score")) defines parameter code parameter. formula calculate Z-score follows: $$\frac{((\frac{obs}{M})^L - 1)}{L * S}$$ "obs" observed value respective anthropometric measure calculated. Permitted Values: List variable-value pairs left default value, NULL, parameter derived output dataset set_values_to_pctl Variables set Percentile specified variables set specified values new observations. example, set_values_to_pctl(exprs(PARAMCD = "WGTHPCTL", PARAM = "Weight--height percentile")) defines parameter code parameter. Permitted Values: List variable-value pair left default value, NULL, parameter derived output dataset

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
text: input dataset additional records new parameter added.

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(lubridate, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(rlang, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(admiral, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(pharmaversesdtm, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  # derive weight for height/length only for those under 2 years old using WHO # weight for length reference file advs <- pharmaversesdtm::dm_peds %>%   select(USUBJID, BRTHDTC, SEX) %>%   right_join(., pharmaversesdtm::vs_peds, by = "USUBJID") %>%   mutate(     VSDT = ymd(VSDTC),     BRTHDT = ymd(BRTHDTC)   ) %>%   derive_vars_duration(     new_var = AAGECUR,     new_var_unit = AAGECURU,     start_date = BRTHDT,     end_date = VSDT,     out_unit = "days"   )  heights <- pharmaversesdtm::vs_peds %>%   filter(VSTESTCD == "HEIGHT") %>%   select(USUBJID, VSSTRESN, VSSTRESU, VSDTC) %>%   rename(     HGTTMP = VSSTRESN,     HGTTMPU = VSSTRESU   )  advs <- advs %>%   right_join(., heights, by = c("USUBJID", "VSDTC"))  advs_under2 <- advs %>%   filter(AAGECUR < 730.5)  who_under2 <- bind_rows(   (admiralpeds::who_wt_for_lgth_boys %>%     mutate(       SEX = "M",       height_unit = "cm"     )   ),   (admiralpeds::who_wt_for_lgth_girls %>%     mutate(       SEX = "F",       height_unit = "cm"     )   ) ) %>%   rename(     HEIGHT_LENGTH = Length,     HEIGHT_LENGTHU = height_unit   )  derive_params_growth_height(   advs_under2,   sex = SEX,   height = HGTTMP,   height_unit = HGTTMPU,   meta_criteria = who_under2,   parameter = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT",   analysis_var = VSSTRESN,   who_correction = TRUE,   set_values_to_sds = exprs(     PARAMCD = "WGTHSDS",     PARAM = "Weight-for-height/length z-score"   ),   set_values_to_pctl = exprs(     PARAMCD = "WGTHPCTL",     PARAM = "Weight-for-height/length percentile"   ) ) #> # A tibble: 162 × 37 #>    USUBJID     BRTHDTC  SEX   STUDYID DOMAIN VSSEQ VSTESTCD VSTEST VSPOS VSORRES #>    <chr>       <chr>    <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <int> <chr>    <chr>  <chr> <chr>   #>  1 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         1 BMI      BMI    NA    16.577… #>  2 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         5 BMI      BMI    NA    16.615… #>  3 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         9 BMI      BMI    NA    16.697… #>  4 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        13 BMI      BMI    NA    16.816… #>  5 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        17 BMI      BMI    NA    16.824… #>  6 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        21 BMI      BMI    NA    16.915… #>  7 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        25 BMI      BMI    NA    17.051… #>  8 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        29 BMI      BMI    NA    17.162… #>  9 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        33 BMI      BMI    NA    17.248… #> 10 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        37 BMI      BMI    NA    17.433… #> # ℹ 152 more rows #> # ℹ 27 more variables: VSORRESU <chr>, VSSTRESC <chr>, VSSTRESN <dbl>, #> #   VSSTRESU <chr>, VSSTAT <chr>, VSLOC <chr>, VSBLFL <chr>, VISITNUM <dbl>, #> #   VISIT <chr>, VISITDY <int>, VSDTC <chr>, VSDY <int>, VSTPT <chr>, #> #   VSTPTNUM <dbl>, VSELTM <chr>, VSTPTREF <chr>, VSEVAL <chr>, EPOCH <chr>, #> #   VSDT <date>, BRTHDT <date>, AAGECUR <dbl>, AAGECURU <chr>, HGTTMP <dbl>, #> #   HGTTMPU <chr>, AVAL <dbl>, PARAMCD <chr>, PARAM <chr>
